verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> Shushan-eduth, <S%H7802><s%> Michtam <S%H4387><s%> of David, <S%H1732><s%> to teach; <S%H3925><s%> when he strove with <S%H5327><s%> <S%H853><s%> Aram-naharaim <S%H763><s%> and with Aram-zobah, <S%H760><s%> when Joab <S%H3097><s%> returned, <S%H7725><s%> and smote <S%H5221><s%> of <S%H853><s%> Edom <S%H123><s%> in the valley <S%H1516><s%> of salt <S%H4417><s%> twelve <S%H8147><s%> <S%H6240><s%> thousand. <S%H505><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> thou hast cast us off, <S%H2186><s%> thou hast scattered <S%H6555><s%> us, thou hast been displeased; <S%H599><s%> O turn <S%H7725><s%> thyself to us again.
Thou hast made the earth <S%H776><s%> to tremble; <S%H7493><s%> thou hast broken <S%H6480><s%> it: heal <S%H7495><s%> the breaches <S%H7667><s%> thereof; for <S%H3588><s%> it shaketh. <S%H4131><s%>
Thou hast showed <S%H7200><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%> hard <S%H7186><s%> things: thou hast made us to drink <S%H8248><s%> the wine <S%H3196><s%> of astonishment. <S%H8653><s%>

Thou hast given <S%H5414><s%> a banner <S%H5251><s%> to them that fear <S%H3373><s%> thee, that it may be displayed <S%H5127><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> of the truth. <S%H7189><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
That <S%H4616><s%> thy beloved <S%H3039><s%> may be delivered; <S%H2502><s%> save <S%H3467><s%> with thy right hand, <S%H3225><s%> and hear <S%H6030><s%> me.

God <S%H430><s%> hath spoken <S%H1696><s%> in his holiness; <S%H6944><s%> I will rejoice, <S%H5937><s%> I will divide <S%H2505><s%> Shechem, <S%H7927><s%> and mete out <S%H4058><s%> the valley <S%H6010><s%> of Succoth. <S%H5523><s%>
Gilead <S%H1568><s%> is mine, and Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> is mine; Ephraim <S%H669><s%> also is the strength <S%H4581><s%> of mine head; <S%H7218><s%> Judah <S%H3063><s%> is my lawgiver; <S%H2710><s%>

Moab <S%H4124><s%> is my washpot; <S%H5518><s%> <S%H7366><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> Edom <S%H123><s%> will I cast out <S%H7993><s%> my shoe: <S%H5275><s%> Philistia, <S%H6429><s%> triumph <S%H7321><s%> thou because <S%H5921><s%> of me.
Who <S%H4310><s%> will bring <S%H2986><s%> me into the strong <S%H4692><s%> city? <S%H5892><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> will lead <S%H5148><s%> me into <S%H5704><s%> Edom? <S%H123><s%>

Wilt not <S%H3808><s%> thou, <S%H859><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> which hadst cast us off? <S%H2186><s%> and thou, O God, <S%H430><s%> which didst not <S%H3808><s%> go out <S%H3318><s%> with our armies? <S%H6635><s%>
Give <S%H3051><s%> us help <S%H5833><s%> from trouble: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6862><s%> for vain <S%H7723><s%> is the help <S%H8668><s%> of man. <S%H120><s%>
Through God <S%H430><s%> we shall do <S%H6213><s%> valiantly: <S%H2428><s%> for he <S%H1931><s%> it is that shall tread down <S%H947><s%> our enemies. <S%H6862><s%>
